decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: [Site Location Plan, 27CR/P/003/E, 27CR/P/004/D, 27CR/P/005/A, Planning Fire Strategy Statement, Site Specific Flood Risk Assessment.]

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Refuse & Recycling (Implementation) - The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until the refuse and recycling storage facilities shown on the approved plans have been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Condition : 5 - Cycle Parking to be implemented - The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until the cycle parking shown on the plans hereby approved has been provided and made available for use. These facilities shall be retained for the occupants of and visitors to the development at all times.

Condition : 6 - The development hereby approved at, 27 Crusoe Road, Mitcham, CR4 3LJ, shall not be occupied other than as a 6 bed 6 person House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) in C4 Use.

Reason: To accord with terms of this application, ensure provision of satisfactory standard of accommodation and safeguard amenity, safeguard local road, parking conditions, highway and pedestrian safety in the locality in accordance with London Plan 2021 Policy D6, Merton's Core Strategy 2011 CS14, Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014 DM D2, DM T1, DM T2, DM T3 and the London Borough of Merton Houses in Multiple Occupation (HMO) Requirements (Revised July 2021).

Condition : 7 - The roof canopy shall be installed/altered as shown on the approved drawings within 3 months of the date of this decision notice.
REASON: To accord with terms of the application and safeguard amenity of nearby occupants in line with Merton Sites and Policies Plan Policy (2014) DM D2.

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:

i) The application was amended following negotiations with the Council to ensure the scheme complied with adopted policy and guidance, and a decision was made with an agreed determination date.

Condition : 9 - INFORMATIVE
The applicant should be aware that additional licenses from Merton Council's Environmental Health Team for the HMO use.

Condition : 10 - INFORMATIVE - Section 106 Agreement 
This planning permission has a Section 106 Agreement which must be read in conjunction with it.
description: APPLICATION FOR THE PROPOSED CHANGE OF USE FROM RESIDENTIAL CLASS C3 TO A 6 BED 6 PERSON HMO CLASS C4 AND RETENTION OF ROOF CANOPY.
